lines.content: * Represents a deadline type of task in the list.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return Indication that the task is a deadline type and if the task
* is done or not followed by its name and deadline.
* Returns true if the object being compared with is equivalent.
* @param obj Object to be compared with.
* @return True if the object is a Deadline with the same name and date.
private static Ui ui = new Ui();
private static Storage storage = new Storage();
private static TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
public static File file = new File("data/list.txt");
Label allo = new Label("allo"); // Creating a new Label control
Scene scene = new Scene(allo); // Setting the scene to be our Label
stage.setScene(scene); // Setting the stage to show our screen
* Represents an event type of task in the list.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return Indication that the task is an event type and if the task
* is done or not followed by its name and date.
* Returns true if the object being compared with is equivalent.
* @param obj Object to be compared with.
* @return True if the object is an Event with the same name and date.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
private static Ui ui = new Ui();
private static Storage storage = new Storage();
private static TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
System.out.println("ARE YOU SURE? SAY Y IF YOU ARE AND LITERALLY ANYTHING ELSE IF YOU AREN'T");
System.out.println("BAYUM! The list has been wiped. How tragic.");
System.out.println("(WHAT IS THIS PERSON TRYING TO SAY WHY IS HE TYPING GIBBERISH I'M JUST TRYING TO SURVIVE)");
* Represents Duke's storage system and handles file operations.
* Checks if the list file exists and creates it if it doesn't.
* @return true if the file exists or was successfully created
* and false if there was an error creating the file.
* Loads the file contents into the list of strings for Duke to use.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file is missing.
File f = new File(filePath); // create a File for the given file path
Scanner s = new Scanner(f); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
* Writes the contents of the list of strings Duke uses into the list file.
* @throws IOException If the file cannot be written to.
* Represents a task in the list.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return Indication of if the task is done or not followed by its name.
* Returns true if the object being compared with is equivalent.
* @param obj Object to be compared with.
* @return True if the object is a Task with the same name. False otherwise.
* Represents the list of strings Duke uses to make changes to the list file.
* Initialises the list and loads the existing contents of the task list file,
* with each line at a separate index.
* @param file File representing the list file.
* @return True if initialisation was successful, false if the list file is missing.
public boolean initialise(File file, Storage storage) {
* Marks a task as done in the list of strings and the task list file.
* @param storage Storage object used by Duke to assist with file handling.
* @taskNo Index of the task that is being marked as done in the list.
* Deletes a task from the list of strings and the task list file.
* @param storage Storage object used by Duke to assist with file handling.
* @param taskNo  Index of the task that is being deleted in the list.
* Adds a task to the list of strings and the task list file.
* @param storage   Storage object used by Duke to assist with file handling.
* @param toBeAdded Task that is being added.
* Represents a to-do type of task in the list.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return Indication that the task is a to-do type and if the task
* is done or not followed by its name.
* Returns true if the object being compared with is equivalent.
* @param obj Object to be compared with.
* @return True if the object is a ToDo with the same name. False otherwise.
* Represents the user interface and displays messages for Duke.
System.out.println("Welcome. I am your virtual assistant Duke. Sparkle up your day (TM).");
return "Welcome. I am your virtual assistant Duke. Sparkle up your day (TM).";
* Displays message for when the user retrieves an empty list.
System.out.println("The list is empty. Good job.");
* Displays the location of the list file.
System.out.println("Your task list is located in: " + path + ". SPARKLEOUS.");
* Displays the error message for when the user enters an invalid input for an integer.
System.err.println("JUST GIVE ME A NUMBER, WHY ARE YOU DOING THIS");
* Displays the error message for when the user enters an index that is out of bounds
System.err.println("hello sir there are only " + listsize + " tasks in the list sir");
* Displays the error message for when the user enters an index that is less than 0
System.err.println("HOW CAN I COMPLETE THE TASK AT INDEX " + number + "? IT DOESNT MAKE ANY SENSE");
* Displays a message to inform the user that the task has been marked as done.
* @param task Task that the user marked as done.
System.out.println(task + " has been marked as done");
* Displays the message for when the user tries to mark a task that is already
System.out.println("It is already done. How SPARKTACULAR.");
* Displays the message to inform the user that the task has been deleted and
* how many items are left in the list.
* @param toBeDeleted Task that the user has deleted.
* @param size        Number of items remaining in the task list.
"There are " + size + " tasks left in the list.");
* Displays the error message for when the user adds a task with no name.
* Displays the message to inform the user that the task has been added to
* @param task Task that the user added.
* Displays number of items in the task list.
* @param size Number of items in the task list.
System.out.println("the list has " + size + " tasks now.");
* Displays the message for when the user tries to add a task that is already
* @param task Task the user is trying to add.
System.out.println(task + " is already in the list sir");
* Displays the error message for when the user enters an event or deadline
System.err.println("BY WHEN? I DONT KNOW AHHHHHHHHHHH");
* Displays the error message for when the user enters an event or deadline
System.err.println("hello sir I only understand YYYY-MM-DD format");
* Displays entries in the task list that contain the search query.
* @param list        The list of strings representing tasks.
* @param searchQuery The search query entered by the user.
System.out.println("Here are the search results for \"" + searchQuery + "\":");
assertEquals(new Ui().showWelcome(),"Welcome. I am your virtual assistant Duke. Sparkle up your day (TM).");
